# Draft:Bahubaleshwar Temple

----
= Bahubaleshwar Temple =
Bahubaleshwar Temple is a Jain temple and spiritual center located in Gharbara, Greater Noida, Uttar Pradesh, India. Inaugurated in February 2025, it is dedicated to Bahubali and features a 23-foot (7.0 m) monolithic granite statue on a landscaped, eco-friendly campus. The templeâ€™s opening Panchkalyanak Mahotsav, led by prominent Jain monks, was broadcast live over multiple days by Adinath TV Channel. Bahubaleshwar Temple is also listed in Jain temple directories as a recognized religious site in Gautam Buddha Nagar district.
History
Bahubaleshwar Temple was inaugurated in February 2025 during a Panchkalyanak Mahotsav ceremony held from 21 to 23 February. The event was led by Jain monks Acharya Shri Shrutsagar Muniraj and Muni Shri Anuman Sagar Ji. The Mahamastakabhishek ritual, which marked the conclusion of the ceremony, was broadcast live by Adinath TV Channel.
Architecture
The temple is designed with an emphasis on environmental sustainability. Features of the temple grounds include:
* A 23-foot (7.0 m) granite statue of Bahubali
* A Miyawaki-style forest with approximately 5,000 trees
* A pond and fountains
* Mud cottages for visitors
* Around 90% green coverage across its two-acre site
Directory Listing
Bahubaleshwar Temple is also listed in Jain temple directories as Shri Bahubaleshwar Digamber Jain Mandir located in Gharbara, Greater Noida, District Gautam Buddha Nagar, Uttar Pradesh.
Religious Philosophy and Activities
Bahubaleshwar Temple promotes Jain philosophical principles such as Anekantavada (the doctrine of multiple viewpoints) and welcomes followers of all Jain sects. The temple practices gender equality by offering women equal rights and opportunities to participate in religious activities. In addition to being a place of worship, the temple functions as a center for study and discussion of Jain philosophy, emphasizing its scientific, rational, and practical aspects.
